item.title: 台湾考虑限制从第三国进口中国汽车
item.description: 据当地媒体报道，比亚迪公司计划通过运输在泰国组装的汽车进入台湾市场，台湾正在评估限制从第三国进口中国品牌汽车的措施。【原文：Taiwan is evaluating measures to restrict the import of Chinese-branded vehicles from third countries, following local media reports that BYD Co. is planning to enter the Taiwanese market by shipping cars assembled in Thailand.】

item.title: 越南贸易超出预期，买家竞相加征特朗普关税
item.description: 越南 7 月份的出口增幅超过预期，因为买家竞相规避将于 8 月 7 日生效的对越南出口美国产品征收 20% 关税的规定。【原文：Vietnam’s exports jumped more than expected in July, with buyers racing to avoid a 20% tariff on the country’s exports to the US set to take effect on Aug. 7.】

item.title: 印度在关键的财务披露截止日期前出现首次公开募股潮
item.description: 印度公司正在向公开市场发起最后冲刺，以期在一个关键的截止日期前吸引全球投资者。【原文：Indian companies are making a last-minute dash to the public markets, aiming to attract global investors before a key deadline.】

item.title: 千禧年向韩国对冲基金公司出售 2.5 亿美元股票
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，千禧管理有限责任公司（Millennium Management LLC）已委托首尔一家对冲基金公司投资 2.5 亿美元，用于投资韩国上市公司。【原文：Millennium Management LLC has entrusted $250 million with a Seoul-based hedge fund firm to invest in Korean listed companies, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 印尼为首次袋鼠债券销售招募投资者
item.description: 本周早些时候的数据显示，印尼的季度经济增长速度达到了两年来的最快水平，因此印尼周三开始就其首次澳元计价债券交易向投资者发出邀请。【原文：Indonesia started sounding out investors Wednesday for its maiden Australian dollar-denominated bond deal after data earlier this week showed quarterly economic growth quickened to the fastest in two years.】

item.title: 据说日本洋名酒制造商考虑私有化
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，日本药用利口酒制造商 Yomeishu Seizo Co.【原文：Yomeishu Seizo Co., a Japanese medicinal liqueur manufacturer, is considering going private and has received acquisition proposals from several investment funds, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国连锁酒店 Atour 据称寻求在香港二次上市
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，连锁酒店雅图仕控股有限公司（Atour Lifestyle Holdings Ltd.）正在考虑在香港进行第二次上市。【原文：Hotel chain Atour Lifestyle Holdings Ltd. is considering a second float in Hong Kong, according to people familiar with the matter, the latest US-listed Chinese firm to weigh such a move amid concern about delisting risks in America.】

item.title: 4.64 亿美元印度首次公开募股超额认购后，NSDL 将首次亮相
item.description: 国家证券存管有限公司的股票将于周三在孟买开始交易，此前该公司在资本市场复苏的背景下进行了首次公开发行，超额认购超过 41 倍。【原文：National Securities Depository Ltd.’s shares are set to begin trading in Mumbai on Wednesday, following an initial public offering that was oversubscribed more than 41 times amid a resurgence in capital markets.】

item.title: OpenAI 正在洽谈股票出售事宜，估值达 5000 亿美元
item.description: 了解投资讨论情况的人士称，OpenAI 正在就可能向现任和前任员工二次出售股票进行早期谈判，估值约为 5000 亿美元，这标志着这家人工智能领军企业的价值获得了巨大提升。【原文：OpenAI is in early talks about a potential secondary sale of stock for current and former employees at a valuation of about $500 billion, people briefed on the investment discussions said, marking an enormous gain in value for the artificial intelligence leader.】

item.title: 印尼股市接近历史新高，未受外资抛售影响
item.description: 由于国内需求旺盛，抵消了大量外资流出的影响，印尼股市正逼近历史最高点。【原文：Indonesian stocks are closing in on an all-time high as booming domestic demand offsets a deluge of foreign outflows.】

item.title: 黄金因经济困境保持二月以来最长连胜纪录
item.description: 由于担心美国经济放缓导致避险需求增加，加上交易商押注利率下调，黄金保持了2月份以来最长的连涨势头。【原文：Gold held its longest streak of gains since February, boosted by fears of a US economic slowdown that have increased haven demand, along with traders’ bets on lower interest rates.】

item.title: 新西兰将在重大道路资金改革中取代汽油税
item.description: 新西兰已宣布计划对道路交通费用进行彻底改革，放弃近一个世纪前开始征收的汽油税。【原文：New Zealand has announced plans for a radical reform of how it pays for roading, turning its back on petrol taxes that were first introduced almost a century ago.】

item.title: 迪斯尼旗下的 ESPN 将通过股权交换收购 NFL 网络及其他资产
item.description: 美国国家橄榄球联盟（National Football League）将把大部分媒体业务出售给迪斯尼公司（Walt Disney Co.【原文：The National Football League will sell most of its media businesses to Walt Disney Co. in exchange for a 10% stake in the ESPN sports networks, deepening the ties between the league and one of its top broadcast partners.】

item.title: 零售交易繁荣推动越南股市上涨 22
item.description: 就在两年多前，越南股市的暴跌让 Pham Nam 损失了 20 亿盾（76269 美元），并导致他卖掉了自己的现代汽车。Nam 发誓再也不投资了。【原文：Just over two years ago, a plunge in Vietnam’s stocks left Pham Nam with a loss of 2 billion dong ($76,269) and led him to sell his Hyundai car. Nam swore he’ll never invest again.】

item.title: 交易商权衡特朗普的关税威胁，原油跌后企稳
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁要对俄罗斯能源买家征收二次关税，而美国数据显示世界最大经济体的经济状况趋于疲软，投资者将目光投向更远的地方，因此石油维持了连续四天的跌势。【原文：Oil held a four-day drop as investors looked beyond a threat from President Donald Trump to impose secondary tariffs on buyers of Russian energy, while US data pointed to softer conditions in the world’s largest economy.】

item.title: 日本 6 月名义工资增长加快，支持日本央行加息
item.description: 日本工人的名义工资以四个月来最快的速度增长，反映了在与雇主的年度谈判中赢得的收益，并助长了市场对日本央行可能在未来几个月内上调基准利率的猜测。【原文：Japanese workers saw their nominal wages rise at the fastest pace in four months, reflecting gains won in annual negotiations with employers and fueling market speculation that the Bank of Japan may hike its benchmark rate in coming months.】

item.title: 国泰航空股价上涨 50%，盈利前面临质疑
item.description: 国泰航空公司（Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd.）可能难以延续其令人印象深刻的股价涨势，因为分析师指出该公司的估值不那么吸引人，而且盈利压力越来越大。【原文：Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd. may struggle to extend its impressive stock rally as analysts point to less attractive valuations and growing pressure on earnings.】

item.title: 中国重启科维时代卫生措施预防蚊媒病毒
item.description: 在结束大流行病应急程序两年多之后，中国在广东省南部恢复了一些 Covid 时代的卫生控制措施，以防止一种令人痛苦的蚊媒病毒性疾病的传播。【原文：More than two years after ending pandemic emergency procedures, China has revived some Covid-era health controls in the southern Guangdong province to prevent the spread of a painful mosquito-borne viral disease.】

item.title: 新西兰经济放缓，失业率创五年新高
item.description: 新西兰第二季度失业率升至近五年来的最高点，这是经济放缓的最新迹象，可能促使央行恢复降息。【原文：New Zealand’s jobless rate rose to the highest in almost five years in the second quarter, the latest sign of an economic slowdown that could prompt the central bank to resume interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 美国银行聘请摩根士丹利的 Giardinelli 担任自然资源部主管
item.description: 美国银行聘请摩根士丹利的 Todd Giardinelli 担任该公司投资银行部门自然资源和能源转型主管，接替升任该业务全球主席的 Ray Wood。【原文：Bank of America Corp. hired Morgan Stanley’s Todd Giardinelli as head of natural resources and energy transition within the firm’s investment-banking unit, succeeding Ray Wood, who was elevated to global chair of the business.】

item.title: 吝啬的消费者对印尼的高增长表示怀疑
item.description: 印尼经济正以两年来最快的速度增长。但并非所有消费者都买账。【原文：Indonesia’s economy is growing at its fastest pace in two years. Not all consumers are buying it.】

item.title: 摩根大通因交易繁荣在日本外资银行盈利中名列第一
item.description: 摩根大通公司去年在日本的业绩超过了全球竞争对手，原因是亚洲国家推动改善公司治理，促进了交易热潮。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. out-earned global rivals in Japan last year after capitalizing on a dealmaking spree fueled by the Asian nation’s push to improve corporate governance.】

item.title: 美国数据给美联储走向蒙上阴影，亚洲交易员态度谨慎：市场综述
item.description: 由于美国服务业数据疲软引发了对美联储政策路径的担忧，在华尔街抹去涨幅之后，亚洲股市周三可能难以找到方向。【原文：Asian stocks may struggle for direction on Wednesday after Wall Street erased gains, as weakening US services data raised concerns about the Federal Reserve’s policy path.】

item.title: 美国消费者监管机构考虑允许银行收取数据费
item.description: 消费者金融保护局（Consumer Financial Protection Bureau）一直在与有意制定开放银行业务规则的利益相关者举行会议，据直接了解讨论情况的人士称，该局对允许贷款机构为获取客户数据收费持接受态度。【原文：The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau has been holding meetings with stakeholders interested in shaping a revamped open banking rule, and has come across as being receptive to permitting lenders to charge for access to customer data, according to people with direct knowledge of the discussions.】

item.title: 关税热潮褪去，亚洲集装箱班轮公司利润将下滑
item.description: 亚洲集装箱班轮公司的利润可能刚刚达到顶峰。【原文：Asian container liners’ profits might have just peaked.】

item.title: 美国称前迈阿密热火队工人偷窃勒布朗价值数百万美元的球衣
item.description: 迈阿密热火队的一名前雇员被指控盗窃数百件纪念品并在网上出售，其中包括勒布朗-詹姆斯在全美篮球协会冠军系列赛中穿过的一件球衣，这件球衣后来在拍卖会上以近 400 万美元的价格售出。【原文：A former Miami Heat employee was charged with stealing hundreds of pieces of memorabilia and selling it online, including a jersey worn by LeBron James in the National Basketball Association’s championship series that later sold for nearly $4 million at auction.】

item.title: 据说 YPF 接近收购道达尔的阿根廷页岩资产
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，阿根廷国营油气生产商 YPF SA 接近达成一项协议，从法国道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies SE）收购页岩油资产。【原文：Argentina’s state-run oil and gas producer YPF SA is close to an agreement to acquire shale oil assets from France’s TotalEnergies SE, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 围绕一个赌注的加密货币市场出现升温迹象
item.description: 艾米丽-梅森（Emily Mason）说："提醒那些生活在岩石下的人们，加密货币 IPO 市场已经升温。Circle 的股价自上市以来已经飙升了 397%，Figure、Bullish、Gemini 和 BitGo 等公司也在伺机而动。它们的业务各不相同，但都与同一股力量息息相关：加密货币情绪。【原文：A reminder for those living under a rock: the market for crypto IPOs has heated up, says Emily Mason.Circle’s stock has jumped 397% since its debut, and names like Figure, Bullish, Gemini, and BitGo are waiting in the wings. They’re different businesses, but they’re all tethered to the same force: crypto sentiment.】

item.title: 市场期待加息，日本央行面临存款机制成本问题
item.description: 随着人们对日本央行将在今年晚些时候加息的猜测不断升温，要求日本央行向其存款机制支付资金的风险越来越大，这可能会给日本央行的财政带来更大压力。【原文：As speculation mounts that the Bank of Japan will raise interest rates later this year, there’s a growing risk that required payments to its deposit facility could put added strain on the bank’s finances.】

item.title: 对美联储降息的押注席卷美国债券市场
item.description: 债券交易员正在加大对美联储今年降息的押注，因为美国经济疲软的迹象增强了央行按照唐纳德-特朗普总统的要求降低借贷成本的理由。【原文：Bond traders are ramping up bets on the Federal Reserve cutting interest rates this year, as signs of a weakening US economy bolster the case for the central bank to reduce borrowing costs as demanded by President Donald Trump.】
